script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Mother, this looks delicious! What are we eating tonight?

lines.text: He always asks, but I always cook the same thing
oh, he is waiting for me to answer

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Hmm... What's that saying again? Eating well everyday...

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Keeps the doctor away!

lines.text: He doesn't always know his place in the family

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Please don't tell me you don't like what you've cooked, mother.

lines.text: His reeactions are 33 percent passive, 67 percent aggressive

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: I have no complaints.

lines.text: My only complaints are that I never hear my daughter. What is wrong with her?
Just look at her. I wish she was more like me.
My sister needs to learn from the mistakes of yesterday and talk
she must know Silent moments are the noisiest moments in our family
I hear her words, but in her voice I hear nothing but complaints.
She is probably thinking that our daughter doesn't like her food.
But I donâ€™t want to get angry again. I just want one nice dinner with my family.
I cannot tell if everything here is what it is or what it isn't
are they looking at me because I did something wrong? or maybe they are not looking at me at all?
my mind often leads me into false analysis

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: And you daughter, do you like the food?

lines.text: she is stressing me out so much, it's exactly what we ate last night.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: Why are your answers always so flat?

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: How can she give other answers if she never tasted anything else?

lines.text: I wish I was able to eat something different, I would take anything else right now.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: If you try you can see beyond the %answer%

lines.text: it's all a matter of perspective, which is very limited for my sister.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: If I want to I can even see beyond all of you.

lines.text: she needs to know that none of us choose to be here.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: But then you are missing the point.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: I wasn't thinking.

lines.text: If you do not think you should not talk
I was feeling

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: You have to see us if you want to get the full picture.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Can you teach me how to see you mother?

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: Tell her my son

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Sister, When I look at our Mother I see the perfect sun-

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: that planted a seed of life that burned my first chakra to the third degree-

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: and made me the young man I have learned to be.

lines.text: I do not understand what he is trying to say

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: Well said.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: I am lost and confused, but okay, go on.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Well, it means your mother is the dream itself. The dream of us melting in the sun.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: Yes, anything can happen if you let it.

lines.text: So much time passed since we last touch each other
I wonder if she will finally let me hold her hand for a bit?
It's been a while since I felt something to him.
What he just said got me emotional, I feel I want to hold his hand.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: My woman, how was your day?

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: A very lovely day, couldn't be better. And yours?

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: I had such a fantastic day, so much rain. Kids, how was school?

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: All day I thought to myself what a wonderful world.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Mother, father, brother you are so beautiful-

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: when you play yourself happy. Beyond a shadow of a dream!

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: That is true.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: Do you think she can tell what is true?

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Any dream is a process of active paranoiac thought-

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: that aims to cause the total disappearance-

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: of the world of reality.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: It ain't her fault mother.

lines.text: They see right through me. This is going to be an adventure.
What is this information for? are there even words for it?
or just ragmented thoughts, full of jump cuts and distortion.
What is this information for? are there even words for it?
or just ragmented thoughts, full of jump cuts and distortion.
What is this information for? are there even words for it?
or just ragmented thoughts, full of jump cuts and distortion.
What is darkness for if not for falling in between worlds?

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Time stopped.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Mother, this looks delicious! what are we having tonight?

lines.text: His readings are showing 78 percent ambiguity.
And because our eyes deceive us I can tell him whatever I feel like eating.
Am I centering my attention on the food because there is something else in this room that I don't want to see?

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Mother, that sounds very deep.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Deep like that bowl of soup?

lines.text: I meant about that bowl that is on the counter.
I will get up now and go get it.
i meant much deeper than that, because the food of our mother reminds me of the end of time.
it makes me think about where i came from, and fear what exists at the end of it all.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Your vision is too shallow to my taste, dear sister.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: I don't mean the taste of our dinners.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: I mean the memories we are boiling in our soups.

lines.text: One day there was a dog that was locked outside.
She barked so loud and made a lot of noise.
So I just went outside and let her drink from this bowl.
Or maybe it was me, it is hard to remember. I think it was a very cold day.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: It is indeed a very nice bowl. Let me look at it.

lines.text: You eat what you have cooked and you need to finish it to the end, even if it is vomit.
I know she loves another, but I will stay with her and not let go.
Even just for these moments like we had with this bowl by the beach.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Here you go son, take it from me.

lines.text: oh, my mother is always so careful about this bowl.
Once I almost dropped it, I felt like the bowl itself drops through my throat and into my stomach.
It filled me with an infinite anxiety, fearing from her eyes and from his hands.
I have been avoiding touching it ever since.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Mommy, take it from me.

lines.text: We got this bowl to our wedding as a gift from his parents.
I remember how his mom hugged me and kissed me that day.
It was the first time I felt belong in my life.
I always liked this bowl more than I ever liked my mother.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: It's a nice bowl. But there is only one way to remember it.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: There is? Can you tell me how?

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: It is a bowl of soup.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: oh, I always thought a memory can come from both directions.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: Yes, the right direction and the wrong one.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: So from which direction does my anger come from?

lines.text: I feel exactly the same, I don't know how to answer this question.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: From your left side

lines.text: it comes from deep, deep inside of you

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: I have heard those things before.

lines.text: I am refusing to be the only one to blame.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: And from the other side - do you see the ocean?

lines.text: I usually do not notice what exist in front of me.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Very true. Usually I notice it everyday.

lines.text: What kind of life exists beyond the ocean? If I could would I start over?

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: The wind is quiet.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Doesn't have to be. I can see us laughing.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Anything can happen if you let it.

lines.text: When it happens believe me you cannot miss it.
For that I might need some wine, I will go bring the bottle from the counter.
Daddy please do not leave me here alone.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: The ships look so distant.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: The wind is moving.

lines.text: Moving bowls moving boats, I wish they would take you with them father.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Father, can you pass me the bottle?

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: All wet.

lines.text: My inside and outside have no borders.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: You are taking us down to a moonless dark night.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Just a landscape of a toothless smile.

lines.text: Shuffling the bowls will also shuffle the sound of their open eyes.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: You have such a vivid memory.

lines.text: Why the glasses are not in the right place? I have to arrange them back in the right order.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: I try to keep track of what makes us a family.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: Dear child, we never been there.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: That's the creepiest thing about stories.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Is there a missing part I forgot about?

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: We can not go anywhere.

lines.text: Especially and most importantly not from here.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: It is cold outside.

lines.text: Distant siren.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Smoke. Try add some smell next time.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: I am grieving and in your memory I am smiling.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Memories can be played. It is just likely that stories will get mixed up in stories.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: When you close your eyes what do you see?

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Usually I see nothing.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: So have no fear of perfection - you will never get it.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: And when your eyes open you see nothing.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: I'll just turn on the light.

lines.text: What is light for if not to say something about our own shadows.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Sister, stop fooling us. We are all hungry and thirsty for concrete images.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: My love, my girl, what is this all made of?

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Daddy, this dinner is made of apples, worms, and dreams.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: Yes, it is almost time to sleep. The best time of the day.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Apples usually turn into liberation.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Worms usually turn into desperation.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Dreams to longing after your own happiness.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Your mind is overwhelmed by dreams and plans.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: What even am I?

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: This is the play of your own mind. Leave attachments behind.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: No solid self.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Longing after your own happiness.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Trapped in the flow of your own thought.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: The clock stopped.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Daddy? Can I ask you something?

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Sure you can my little pumpkin.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Why are there families at all and not nothing?

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Oh, that is a tricky one, Mother?

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: They keep you from getting lost in the noise.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: What ground do families come from?

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: Homes.
